0.title: Varun issued challan in Kanpur after video of him riding bike without helmet goes viral
0.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan was issued a challan by the traffic police in Kanpur after a video of him riding a bike without helmet went viral. The bike's number plate also violated the guidelines laid out by the traffic police, India Today reported. Varun is in Kanpur for the shooting of his upcoming film 'Bawaal'.

1.title: Sri Lankan army denies rumours of crackdown on protesters
1.article_body: The Sri Lankan army has denied the rumours of a possible crackdown on citizens protesting against the government amid the economic crisis. "Troops as everyone witnessed in the past few days, have not at all interfered with any of those peaceful protesters or organisations, nor have they acted against the interests of the State," said the army.

2.title: North Korea claims it tested new guided weapons system
2.article_body: North Korea has tested a new guided weapons system that would improve "the firepower of the frontline long-range artillery units", said its state media. It would enhance the efficiency in the operation of tactical nukes, it added. The time and place of the test were not revealed. This comes ahead of the joint military exercises by US and South Korea.

3.title: States in India should create diverse public health management cadre: Centre
3.article_body: States in India should create a multidisciplinary public health management cadre, the Union Health Ministry proposed on Saturday, offering a framework to separate the clinical cadre from the public health cadre, which would lead to more effective public health care delivery. The clinical role would be separate from managerial roles to improve overall efficiency, according to the framework.

4.title: Was out for 10 solid days, haven't felt so sick in my life: Aaron Paul on COVID
4.article_body: Actor Aaron Paul said that he was "out for 10 solid days" after testing positive for COVID-19. "I have never felt more sick in my life. And so we couldn't do the [Weird AI Yankovic biopic] cameo, which I just absolutely was crushed about," Paul said. Aaron reportedly tested positive the day he was to go on set for shooting.

5.title: Don't know what’s happening: Manjrekar on Rohit scoring 114 runs in 6 games
5.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said MI captain Rohit Sharma "looks in fine form" but he doesn't know why the 34-year-old isn't able to score runs in the ongoing season. "When Rohit scores even 20, it seems like the machine is fine. But suddenly...he gets out," Manjrekar added. So far, Rohit has scored 114 runs in six games this season.

6.title: Half-burnt body of woman found in GB Nagar; daughter is suspect
6.article_body: A woman's partially-burnt body was found lying in her kitchen in Gautam Buddha Nagar's Dankaur on Friday. The victim's son called the police after his seven-year-old son found her grandmother's body. The police suspect the role of the victim's daughter, who was reportedly having a disagreement with her mother over ₹15 lakh insurance money from her father's death.

7.title: I am neither anti-India nor anti-America: Imran Khan in Karachi rally
7.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan at a Karachi rally said he is not against any country including India. "I am not against any country. Neither I am anti-India, anti-Europe, nor anti-America. I am with humanity... I am not against any community," he said. Khan's party PTI has staged several protests against the US for an alleged "foreign conspiracy" against him.

8.title: Can't blame him, it was his first game: Pant on Marsh scoring 14(24) vs RCB
8.article_body: Talking about Mitchell Marsh's performance against RCB, DC captain Rishabh Pant admitted that the Australian all-rounder "looked a bit rusty". Pant, however, also added, "[We] can't blame Marsh, it was his first match." Marsh came in to bat when DC were 50/1 in five overs while chasing the 190-run target. Marsh scored 14(24) as they lost by 16 runs.

9.title: Russia tells Ukrainian troops in Mariupol to 'lay down arms'
9.article_body: Russian Defence Ministry has told Ukrainian troops in Mariupol to "stop any hostilities and lay down their arms" from 6 am Moscow time (8.30 am IST) on Sunday. This comes after it claimed that it has cleared all Ukrainian forces from the port city and only a few remained in the Azovstal steelworks. The claim isn't independently verified, Reuters reported.

10.title: Minor fire breaks out at Delhi's Uphaar Cinema; no injuries reported
10.article_body: A minor fire broke out inside the Uphaar Cinema in Delhi on Sunday morning. Nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot after fire officials received a call at 4:46 am. It took firefighters reportedly two hours to douse the fire. It's the same theatre where a massive fire incident in 1997 had killed 59 people and injured over 100.

11.title: Tusshar Kapoor is my biggest supporter in the film industry: Kangana
11.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has said Tusshar Kapoor is her biggest supporter in the film industry. "In this entire film industry, he supports me so much. It's unbelievable. Even in all kinds of fights that I have with film industry people, Tusshar is the first one to support me," she added. Kangana spoke after welcoming him on her reality show, 'Lock Upp'.

12.title: 11 persons arrested for selling illegal liquor in Chandigarh
12.article_body: As many as 11 people were arrested for selling illegal liquor in areas near Chandigarh’s Ram Darbar and Hallo Majra on Friday. All those arrested were later bailed out. The development took place after authorised liquor contractors raised objections to the sale of unauthorised and illegal liquor in the areas and took up the issue with senior police officers.

13.title: Heat wave warning issued for 11 states/UTs over 4 days, list released
13.article_body: IMD has issued heat wave warning for 11 states/UTs over four days. Heat wave conditions are likely to prevail over Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi and Rajasthan till April 19. Himachal Pradesh and Jammu are likely to witness current spell of heat wave till April 18. UP, Maharashtra, West Bengal and Madhya Pradesh might also witness heat wave over four days.

14.title: She's like my daughter, got emotional after seeing her as bride: Alia's driver
14.article_body: Alia Bhatt's driver and bodyguard Sunil Talekar in an interview revealed that he has been working with the Bhatt family ever since the actress was five years old. "Be it taking her to school or...first day of shoot, Alia has been my responsibility. She's like my daughter," he added. "I got really emotional after seeing her dressed as...bride," said Sunil.

15.title: Village in Spain changes its name to 'Ukraine' in show of support
15.article_body: A village in Spain has changed its name to 'Ukraine' in a show of support to the latter country amid its conflict with Russia. A sign at the village's entrance now reads 'Ukraine' instead of Fuentes de Andalucia. Furthermore, a person said that the village had also raised €3,500 (nearly ₹2.89 lakh) for a planned refugee centre in two days.

16.title: Agent seeking visas cheated of ₹26.40 lakh in Noida; 2 arrested
16.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Noida for allegedly cheating a travel agent of ₹26.40 lakh on the pretext of arranging visas for 15 people. The travel agent was in touch with 15 Nepali nationals seeking visas to visit Portugal, said police. The suspects did not return the passports they had taken and refused to return the money, added police.

17.title: Twitter board’s interest not aligned with shareholders: Musk in reply to a tweet
17.article_body: Responding to a tweet amid his $43 billion takeover offer, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the economic interests of the Twitter board are "simply not aligned with shareholders". Musk was replying to a tweet about board members' stock holdings. The Tesla CEO also said, "Wow, with Jack (Dorsey) departing, the Twitter board collectively owns almost no shares!"

18.title: TRS to hold foundation day celebrations in Hyderabad on April 27
18.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi will hold its party formation day celebrations in Hyderabad on April 27. The day-long foundation day celebrations, which will kickstart by hoisting the party's flag, will be held at the Hyderabad International Convention Centre. TRS President K Chandrashekar Rao has directed all leaders and representatives to be present at the venue by 10 am on April 27.

19.title: Man absconding after killing daughter-in-law surrenders in Thane
19.article_body: A 76-year-old real estate developer, Kashinath Patil, who had been on the run since allegedly killing his daughter-in-law for not serving him proper breakfast, surrendered before police in Thane on Saturday. According to the police, Patil had a firearm license since 2007 and claimed that he needed it against possible threats he may face in the real estate business.

20.title: 14 dead, over 12,000 houses damaged in Assam in 2 days due to heavy storm
20.article_body: Heavy storm and lightning claimed 14 lives and damaged over 12,000 houses in several districts of Assam in two days, according to State Disaster Management Authority. A total of 7,344 houses were either partially or fully damaged in the affected districts on Friday, while 4,768 other houses were damaged on Saturday. Over 21,000 people were affected due to the storms.

21.title: Debina, Gurmeet share post to reveal baby's name, name their daughter Lianna
21.article_body: Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary have announced their newborn baby's name. The two took to Instagram to share a post with their daughter's name and announced that they have named their daughter Lianna Choudhary. A separate Instagram account has also been made for Lianna and she was also tagged in the post shared by her parents.

22.title: Seems like MI are probably going to finish last this season: Manjrekar
22.article_body: After MI lost their sixth straight match in the ongoing IPL season, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said the Rohit Sharma-led side are probably going to finish last this season. "Despite the kind of players they picked [at the auction], I was not expecting them to play so poorly," he added. MI lost to LSG by 18 runs on Saturday.

23.title: 8 Delhi Police personnel injured in clashes on Hanuman Jayanti; 9 arrested so far
23.article_body: Nine persons, including eight police personnel and a civilian, were injured in incidents of stone-pelting and communal clashes during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday. "A sub-inspector sustained a bullet injury. His condition is stable," DCP (Northwest) Usha Rangnani said. So far, nine persons have been arrested in this connection, she added.

24.title: UK PM Boris Johnson to visit Gujarat and Delhi for the first time this week
24.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson will visit India this week for the first time as PM. The MEA said he will visit Gujarat on April 21 and hold consultations with PM Narendra Modi on April 22. The UK said his meeting with PM Modi will focus on boosting economic, defence, security and technology co-operation in the face of shared global challenges.

25.title: India releases 2 Pakistani nationals who crossed Indian border accidentally
25.article_body: Two Pakistani nationals, Sarwar Baig and Mohammad Asif, who had reportedly crossed the Indian border in 2016 and 2018 respectively, have been released by India. The two were released after checking of their papers and completion of custom immigration. Baig said that he crossed the border by mistake and is happy to go back to his family.

26.title: Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private ruled 'false' by US judge, claim investors
26.article_body: Tesla investors have alleged that a federal judge on April 1 ruled that CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets about having secured financing to take the company private were "false and misleading”. In a court filing, the investors who are suing Musk over his tweets, added that Musk "used his fame and notoriety to sway public opinion in his favour."

27.title: Kerala is in grip of goons: V Muraleedharan after RSS worker killed in Palakkad
27.article_body: After an RSS worker was killed in Kerala’s Palakkad on Saturday, Union Minister V Muraleedharan said the state is in the grip of "goons". "I would like to urge CM to rein in all such elements who are creating anarchy in the state," Muraleedharan added. The deceased, Srinivasan, was allegedly attacked by a group of assailants at his shop.

28.title: Police officer suspended after Punjab MLA finds liquor at police post
28.article_body: A police post in-charge in Punjab's Mubarakpur was suspended after AAP MLA for Dera Bassi Kuljit Singh Randhawa found liquor bottles on the former's table during a surprise inspection there. Randhawa said that the matter will be reviewed after receiving medical reports. The suspended police in-charge and other police officers had been allegedly found consuming liquor at the police station.

29.title: World's highest tunnel to come up at 16,580 ft; to connect Himachal, Ladakh
29.article_body: The Border Roads Organisation will construct the world's highest tunnel at a height of 16,580 feet. This tunnel will connect Himachal Pradesh to Zanskar Valley in Ladakh. BRO Director General Lieutenant General Rajeev Chaudhry said that the construction of the tunnel will start by July this year and will be completed by 2025.

30.title: I don't understand it: Sunil Gavaskar on KL Rahul's celebration
30.article_body: Referring to KL Rahul's 'fingers in ears' celebration after slamming his third IPL hundred, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said, "This is something which I don't understand. He is shutting out the noise when he is got the hundred." He added, "You do this when you have scored four, five, six runs. When you get a hundred, you enjoy the applause."

31.title: People went from calling me 'charsi' to 'kya body hai': Sanjay Dutt
31.article_body: Recalling the time when he recovered from drug addiction, actor Sanjay Dutt said, "When I came back from rehab, people used to call me charsi." He added, "And I thought...'This is wrong...I'd have to do something.' So I started working out. I wanted to break through that. And then from charsi...it became a guy with swag and 'kya body hai'."

32.title: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov vows to rebuild Mariupol post-war
32.article_body: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov has pledged to rebuild Mariupol where his mining and steel company Metinvest is based. He added, "My ambition is to return to a Ukrainian Mariupol and implement our (new production) plans so that Mariupol-produced steel can compete in global markets as before." According to Forbes magazine, Akhmetov's net worth currently stands at $3.9 billion.

33.title: Started drugs to look cool to women, was in my room or bathroom for 10 years: Sanjay Dutt
33.article_body: Recalling the time when he did drugs, actor Sanjay Dutt said, "I was very shy, especially with women, so I started it to look cool." He added, "You do it and you become a cooler guy with the ladies...you talk to them." He stated, "Ten years of my life I was in my room...or in bathroom...and not interested in shoots."

34.title: India reports 1,150 COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hours
34.article_body: India has reported 1,150 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,558, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,751. The country saw 954 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

35.title: Pune to get shelter home for gay, trans, intersex adults
35.article_body: A Pune-based organisation, Bindu Queer Rights Foundation, is planning to set up a shelter home for gay, transsexual and intersex adults in the city. The organisation aims to cater to those who have been cast out of their homes owing to their sexuality. "We are starting with a very small capacity of three persons," said the director of the organisation.

36.title: Fake gossip: Amina Muaddi denies A$AP Rocky cheating on Rihanna with her
36.article_body: Shoe designer Amina Muaddi has denied having an affair with Rihanna's partner A$AP Rocky through a statement she shared on Instagram. Muaddi wrote, "I've always believed that an unfounded lie spread on social media doesn't deserve any response or clarification, especially one that is so vile." She added, "I initially assumed...this fake gossip...would not be taken seriously."

37.title: Mumbai woman who fell off train to resist phone snatcher succumbs to injuries
37.article_body: A 49-year-old clerk of the government rationing department, who fell off a train while chasing a mobile phone snatcher at Mumbai's Mahim railway station, succumbed to her injuries. According to police, she lost her balance and fell off the train while trying to resist the phone snatcher. She had suffered multiple fractures on her head and nose, a doctor said.

38.title: Warner gave us every chance to win, we need to learn from mistakes: Pant
38.article_body: After their 16-run defeat against RCB, DC captain Rishabh Pant said opener David Warner, who scored 66(38), gave them every chance to win the game. "We could've done better in the middle overs...We'll have to talk about doing better as a team, we'll have to learn from our mistakes," he added. DC are now placed eighth on the points table.

39.title: Noida Police on alert, conduct flag march after Jahangirpuri violence
39.article_body: After the stone-pelting incident in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, the Noida Police is reportedly on alert. The Police also carried out a flag march to establish an atmosphere of faith and security for the public. "I appeal to the public to maintain peace and not pay heed to rumours," Love Kumar, Joint Police Commissioner (Law and Order), said.

40.title: Gauri Khan, Arjun, Malaika attend Ranbir-Alia's post-wedding bash
40.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt hosted a post-wedding party at their residence on Saturday evening. It was attended by Karan Johar, Gauri Khan, Tara Sutaria, Shweta Bachchan, Shakun Batra, Arjun Kapoor and Malaika Arora. Aditya Roy Kapur and Luv Ranjan were also spotted at the event. Ranbir and Alia got married in an intimate wedding ceremony on April 14.

41.title: Mob pelts stones at Hubballi police station; 4 policemen injured
41.article_body: Four police officers were injured after a mob pelted stones at a police station and police vehicles in Karnataka's Hubballi on Saturday night, following which Section 144 was imposed in the city. The mob had reportedly sought action against an objectionable WhatsApp status. The police had resorted to lathi-charge and used tear gas shells to disperse the crowd.

42.title: 29 liquor bottles recovered from cars parked at Mohali hospital, 2 held
42.article_body: The Police recovered 29 bottles of Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL) and four boxes of beer from two cars parked on the premises of Shalby Hospital, Mohali. The cars are registered in the name of the hospital. Two drivers have been arrested in this matter, under the Excise Act, after the keys of the cars were found with them.

43.title: Pune reports 34 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
43.article_body: Pune saw 34 new COVID-19 infections on Saturday with the total case count standing at over 14.5 lakh. As the district didn't report any death due to the virus in the same period, the total fatality count remained at 20,538. According to CoWIN, around 1.79 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in the district.

44.title: No matter how well I perform, he will win with expressions: Ram Charan on dad
44.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that his problem is that no matter how well he performs, his dad and actor Chiranjeevi will win over the audiences with his grace and expressions. Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi said that he was tensed and thought how would he match steps with Ram Charan in the song 'Bhale Bhale Banjara'.

45.title: I didn't have a sort of happy childhood, it was rough: Elon Musk
45.article_body: The world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while talking about how his childhood shaped his business sensibility said, he "didn’t have a sort of happy childhood". Musk added, "It was quite, quite rough, but I read a lot of books." Speaking about his Asperger's syndrome, he said that might have helped him drive to build Tesla and SpaceX.

46.title: Karthik is in form of his life, lucky to have him: Plessis after win vs DC
46.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis praised wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, stating that the 36-year-old is in the form of his life in the ongoing IPL season. "[I'm] lucky to have him in our side," he added. Karthik came in to bat when RCB were 92/5 against DC and scored 66*(34) to help them post 189/5. RCB won by 16 runs.

47.title: NIA files charge sheet against 3 ISIS recruiters in B'luru court
47.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Saturday filed a supplementary charge sheet against three men accused of radicalising and recruiting gullible Muslim youth into ISIS at a special court in Bengaluru. The trio used to allegedly also fund visits of such youths to ISIS areas like Syria, an official said. The accused allegedly did so through a "Quran Circle" group.

48.title: Delhi man kills his wife, son at home; confesses on family WhatsApp group
48.article_body: A 40-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and 15-year-old son in their house in Delhi's Shahdara. The accused's parents claimed he informed them about the crime after he was called to their house for tea and left after saying he would kill himself. Later, he also allegedly confessed to the crime on a family WhatsApp group.

49.title: Delhi LG assured guilty won’t be spared: Kejriwal on Jahangirpuri violence
49.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) Anil Baijal on Saturday condemned the incident of violence in Jahangirpuri and spoke with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal regarding the matter. "Spoke to LG. He assured that all steps are being taken to ensure peace and that guilty will not be spared," Kejriwal tweeted. Baijal also spoke with Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana.

50.title: Virat Kohli's tweet on Shanker Basu goes viral after his one-handed flying catch
50.article_body: Virat Kohli's tweet on RCB's strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu went viral after he took a one-handed flying catch to dismiss DC captain Rishabh Pant. The tweet read, "The difference between a good attempt and a good catch is the work you do in the gym- Shanker Basu. Thanks for imbibing the 'Get better by 1%' attitude in me."

51.title: 12 injured in shooting at mall in US' South Carolina; 3 detained
51.article_body: Twelve people were injured, 10 of them by gunfire, in a shooting that erupted inside a shopping mall in Columbia, South Carolina. Three people who had firearms have been detained in connection with the shooting at Columbiana Centre, Columbia Police Chief WH Holbrook said. He said at least one of those three people fired a weapon.

52.title: Imran Khan kept Rolex watches, iPhone among gifts he got as Pak PM: Report
52.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan during his regime reportedly received 58 gifts amounting to over PKR 140 million which he either kept without payment or paid a negligible amount against it. Gifts for which he paid a small amount included Rolex watches, an iPhone and a necklace among others. He reportedly sold Toshakhana gifts worth PKR 140 million in Dubai.

53.title: 21-year-old woman molested by 2 bike-borne men in Pune; FIR filed
53.article_body: A 21-year-old woman has filed a First Information Report (FIR) after she was allegedly molested by two bike-borne men in Pune. The incident had taken place on Friday in the Bharati Vidyapeeth area while the woman was returning home from a gymnasium. The duo had reportedly escaped after the woman shouted for help when they molested her.

54.title: B'luru Police book a dozen private loan app firms for alleged cheating
54.article_body: The Bengaluru cybercrime police have booked a dozen private firms for cheating. Reports said that these firms are being run by Chinese nationals or companies and dupe people by allegedly giving them instant loans through mobile applications. Ten cases have been registered with police between February 28 and April 13. Police said 59 companies have been named in these cases.

55.title: Virat Kohli waves at Anushka Sharma after taking one-handed flying catch, pics go viral
55.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) batter Virat Kohli waved at his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, after taking a one-handed flying catch to dismiss Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. Kohli was seen making the victory sign while looking towards Anushka. Pant got out for 34(17). RCB went on to defeat DC by 16 runs.

56.title: Hyd Police Commissioner thanks team for peaceful processions, shares pics
56.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand took to Twitter to share pictures from processions held in the city. "Both Sri Ramnavami and Hanuman Shoba Yatra processions have gone on peacefully. This wouldn't have been possible without hard work and foresight of excellent team of officers I have in HCP. We thank people and organisers for their cooperation with police," he wrote.

57.title: Was amused there are separate airport, gym looks; later accepted it: Bhumika
57.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla said that she was initially amused by the fact that there are separate gym and airport looks. "Later on, I accepted it. Actors are now putting in more effort because they know they would be clicked," she said. She added that it's the trend now and that one can't do much about it.

58.title: Punjab CM should apologise for violating 'maryada': Gurdwara body
58.article_body: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee has demanded that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann apologises to the Sikh community for allegedly violating gurudwara 'maryada'. SGPC said his visit to the Gurudwara Damdama Sahib in an alleged inebriated state was against the reverence of the Guru's house. This comes after SAD chief Sukhbir Badal accused Mann of visiting the Bathinda gurdwara while drunk.

59.title: Karthik smashes 66*(34) as RCB defeat DC to go 3rd on IPL 2022 points table
59.article_body: RCB defeated DC by 16 runs to register their fourth win in IPL 2022 and jump to third position on IPL 2022 points table. Dinesh Karthik slammed an unbeaten 66 off 34 deliveries as RCB put up a total of 189/5. DC were restricted to 173/7 as RCB pacers Josh Hazlewood and Mohammed Siraj took three and two wickets, respectively.

60.title: 8-month-old dies after traffic blocked for Andhra minister's rally
60.article_body: An eight-month-old infant, who was being taken to a hospital in an auto-rickshaw in Andhra Pradesh, reportedly died after police stopped traffic to facilitate the victory rally of newly-appointed minister Usha Charan. Her parents alleged that a half-an-hour delay in taking the baby to the hospital resulted in her death. The incident occurred near Kalyandurgam in Anantapur district on Friday.

61.title: M&M to sell stake in Mahindra Sanyo Special Steel in ₹212-cr deal
61.article_body: Automotive manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) has announced that it will sell its stake of over 34.75 lakh shares in Mahindra Sanyo Special Steel Pvt Ltd (MSSSPL) to Japan-based Sanyo Special Steel. M&M declared in a regulatory filing that post the ₹212 crore deal, its holding in MSSSPL will be nil. Turnover of MSSSPL was ₹834.43 crore as of FY21.

62.title: Dozens killed in Pak military raids on 2 Afghan provinces: Reports
62.article_body: Dozens of people were killed in airstrikes launched during cross-border military raids by the Pakistani military on Afghanistan's Kunar and Khost provinces on Saturday, according to reports. In response, the Taliban said that it strongly condemns Pakistan's attacks on Khost and Kunar. A report claimed that hundreds of residents in Khost took to the streets to protest the airstrikes.

63.title: ICICI Prudential Life reports 2-fold jump in net profit in Jan-Mar
63.article_body: ICICI Prudential Life Insurance recorded a Q1 net profit of ₹185 crore, driven by steady growth in new business. Its value for new business for FY2022 at ₹2,163 crore is up 33.4% from FY2021. "In March, we posted the best-ever monthly sales by the company in any year since inception," said NS Kannan, MD & CEO, ICICI Prudential Life.

64.title: BJP broke myth one party can't form govt in U'khand 2nd time: CM
64.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who was re-elected to the post following BJP's win, said they "broke the myth" that one political party cannot form government after one term in the state. Dhami, while attending 'Ayodhya Parv' in Delhi, further said, "People used to say I became Uttarakhand CM at...wrong time". Notably, Dhami had lost his seat in the elections.

65.title: Guj HC lawyer, friend die after falling off motorcycle on highway
65.article_body: Two persons including a Gujarat High Court lawyer died in a road accident on National Highway 48 on Friday. The lawyer, Hirak Ganguly, was riding pillion on a motorcycle with his friend who lost control, causing both of them to fall to the ground. Ganguly was run over by a speeding vehicle and brought dead to the hospital.

66.title: Man arrested with brown sugar worth ₹10 lakh in MP's Indore
66.article_body: A man was arrested with around 125 grams of brown sugar worth ₹10 lakh in MP's Indore on Friday. The crime branch had received information about a potential delivery of drugs to someone in Chandan Nagar and managed to catch the accused when he tried to flee. The accused later admitted to supplying the drugs in various places including Rajasthan.

67.title: No upper limit on Ukrainian refugees that we'll take: Germany
67.article_body: Transport Minister Volker Wissing said Germany will not set any limit on the number of Ukrainian refugees it will admit. "Germany cannot and will not turn back any refugees from Ukraine," Wissing said. Over five million people have fled Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. "We have to expect further escalation and be prepared," he added.

68.title: 'Unpredictable consequences' if US continues to arm Ukraine: Russia
68.article_body: Russia reportedly warned the US of "unpredictable consequences" if it continues to arm Ukraine. "We call on the US and its allies to stop the irresponsible militarisation of Ukraine, which implies unpredictable consequences for regional and international security," Russia said in a diplomatic note. US President Joe Biden on Wednesday approved $800 million worth of military assistance to Ukraine.

69.title: 6 terror suspects with Al-Qaeda network links arrested in Assam
69.article_body: Six suspected terrorists having links with an Al-Qaeda network in Bangladesh were reportedly arrested in Barpeta, Assam. "We arrested the six persons on the basis of information provided by a jihadi who was arrested on March 4," Superintendent of Police Amitava Sinha said. Those arrested were having direct links with members of 'Al-Qaeda in Indian Sub continent' (AQIS), police said.

70.title: MI batter Dewald Brevis reminds me of Kevin Pietersen: Swann
70.article_body: During MI batter Dewald Brevis' innings of 13-ball 31 against LSG in IPL, ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said the 18-year-old South African reminds him of Kevin Pietersen with the way he dominates the bowlers. Brevis' knock included six fours and one six. "(Brevis is) tall, looks to...dominate with his presence at the crease, (is) a horror to bowlers," he added.

71.title: 3 people accuse TRS leaders of corruption, kill selves in T'gana
71.article_body: A member of the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS), B Sai Ganesh, allegedly killed himself by consuming pesticide at a police station in Khammam after accusing TRS leaders of corruption. In another such incident, a real estate developer and his mother allegedly died by suicide in Kamareddy district. A suicide note was recovered, where the victim accused TRS leaders of extortion.

72.title: Prez Biden nominates Indian-American diplomat as his envoy to Mali
72.article_body: The White House on Friday announced that US President Joe Biden has nominated Indian-American diplomat Rachna Sachdeva Korhonen as his envoy to Mali. Korhonen is a career member of the Senior Foreign Service, class of Counselor, it said in a statement. She also had assignments at the US Consulate General in Mumbai, according to the statement.

73.title: Singapore PM Loong says Finance Minister Wong to succeed him as PM
73.article_body: Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on Saturday said Finance Minister Lawrence Wong will succeed him as the next leader of the city-state. "The plan is for Lawrence to succeed me as PM, either before or after the next General Election," Loong, 70, said. Wong, 49, helped Singapore through the COVID-19 pandemic as co-chair of the government's task force.

74.title: Occasional adultery won't deprive wife of maintenance after divorce: Delhi HC
74.article_body: Occasional and isolated acts of adultery committed by a woman do not disentitle her from receiving maintenance after divorce, the Delhi High Court has said. It further stated that only continuous and repeated acts of adultery by the wife would deprive a woman of the grant of payment of an allowance from her husband.

75.title: Lack of partnerships cost us the game vs LSG: MI captain Rohit
75.article_body: MI skipper Rohit Sharma said that a lack of partnerships cost his team the match against LSG at Brabourne Stadium in ongoing IPL. "It wasn't a moment. We tried to put the team before the individual, so we tried to keep...key bowlers in...back-end but it didn't workout," he stated. Chasing a 200-run target, MI managed 181/9 in 20 overs.

76.title: PM Modi praises Gujarat CM for his 'effective leadership' in state
76.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote to Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel lauding the work he has done since taking oath as the CM. PM Modi said that the decisions he has taken in the past 200 days for the state's development reflect his 'effective leadership'. In the letter, he also referred to the support received by BJP in assembly elections.

77.title: Drug lord wanted worldwide caught after model posts pic of them kissing online
77.article_body: Drug lord Brian Donaciano Olguin Berdugo, who is wanted in several countries worldwide, was arrested in Colombia after his model girlfriend uploaded his photo to Facebook, police said. The couple reportedly stayed together for a few days in a luxury apartment. The Mexican national, also known as 'Pitt', is thought to have arrived in the country in February.

78.title: Send money to increase forex reserves: Nepal to citizens abroad
78.article_body: Nepal's Finance Minister Janardan Sharma on Saturday asked Nepalese citizens living abroad to deposit funds in domestic banks as part of efforts to preserve foreign exchange reserves. If one lakh Nepalese nationals living abroad deposited $10,000 each in Nepali banks, it could go a long way to help Nepal overcome the current liquidity constraints, he added.

79.title: No question of removing mosque, temple loudspeakers: Maha minister
79.article_body: Maharashtra government has issued instructions against removing loudspeakers from mosques. Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said, "Loudspeakers are allowed within the permitted decibel limit and if anyone violates that then legal action will be taken." He added, "There is no question of removing loudspeakers from mosques or temples that have taken permission."

80.title: Liverpool beat Manchester City 3-2 in FA Cup semi-final
80.article_body: Liverpool on Saturday beat Manchester City 3-2 in the semi-final of the FA Cup. Two goals by Sadio Mane and one by Ibrahima Konate gave Liverpool a 3-0 lead at half-time. Liverpool have reached their first FA Cup final in a decade. Chelsea and Crystal Palace will face each other on Sunday in the other semi-final.

81.title: Odisha woman sold in Rajasthan for ₹1.5 lakh, 5 arrested
81.article_body: The Odisha Police rescued a woman who was allegedly sold for ₹1.5 lakh in Rajasthan and arrested five people in the case. Police said that the victim, who is married, was trafficked by a woman and two of her aides. "Later, she was married off to a man named Manoj Prajapati against her will," Jharsuguda SP Bikas Chandra Das said.

82.title: Many things to learn from TMC: BJP MP after party's defeat in WB by-polls
82.article_body: After BJP's defeat in the recently held by-polls in West Bengal, BJP MP Saumitra Khan said that there are many things to learn from Trinamool Congress. Khan said, "The inexperienced leaders should be replaced...else there will be more debacles for...BJP." "TMC knows how to play politics...Ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections, they'll conduct Hindu festivals for public connect," he added.

83.title: Global warming an issue not only for India but for the world: Birla
83.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla suggested people keep their surroundings safe and avoid misusing natural resources. Speaking at the Parliamentary Research and Training Institute for Democracies programme, he urged the gathering to preserve the environment by using innovative ways. He also stated that global warming is an issue not only for India but also for the whole world.

84.title: HDFC Bank year-on-year profit up by 24% in Q1
84.article_body: Keeping in line with analysts' expectations, India's largest private sector lender HDFC Bank has reported a jump of 24% year-on-year (Y-O-Y) in its consolidated net profit for the Jan-March, 2022 quarter. The lender's gross non-performing assets were at 1.17% of its gross advances, as compared to 1.32% last year. Its consolidated net profit is at ₹10,474 crore.

85.title: It's a special day, special hundred: Rahul on his 103* in 100th IPL game
85.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 103 runs in his 100th IPL match, LSG captain KL Rahul said it's a "special day" and a "special hundred". He added, "I wasn't among the runs but the pitch was good and I made the most of it." Rahul was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in his side's 18-run win against MI at Brabourne Stadium.

86.title: Congress is like a dead horse, no point flogging it: Raghav Chadha
86.article_body: Reacting to political strategist Prashant Kishor's meeting with the Congress, Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha said Congress is like a "dead horse" and "there is no point flogging it". "Congress Party cannot give an alternative to the country. Only Arvind Kejriwal can challenge PM Narendra Modi and BJP," he added.

87.title: Those capable should give up reservation: BJP MP Jaskaur Meena
87.article_body: Jaskaur Meena, a BJP MP from Rajasthan, has said that those capable should give up the benefits of reservation. "I am sitting in front of you as an MP, though I could not even go to school...after becoming an MP, my children do not avail benefits of reservation," she said. Meena served as a Union Minister during the Vajpayee government.

88.title: Taliban asks students and teachers to not wear neckties in schools
88.article_body: The Taliban authorities have asked students and teachers to stop wearing neckties in schools in Afghanistan, a local media report said on Friday. "The...decision...to impose new restrictions on the appearance of teachers and students is not a logical decision," a university instructor said. The order also asked female teachers to wear hijabs.

89.title: Cristiano Ronaldo hat-trick helps Man Utd beat Norwich 3-2 in PL
89.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo on Saturday scored a hat-trick to help Manchester United beat Norwich City 3-2 in the Premier League. Ronaldo scored the 50th hat-trick of his club career. Brighton and Hove Albion beat Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 while Southampton beat Arsenal 1-0. Manchester United will face second-placed Liverpool next in the Premier League on Tuesday.

90.title: Explosion aboard oil tanker off Hong Kong kills 1, injures 7
90.article_body: An explosion aboard an oil tanker in waters off Hong Kong has killed one person and injured seven others, authorities reported. The Hong Kong government had dispatched two helicopters with doctors to transport the injured to a hospital in the city. The cause of the explosion, which sparked a fire on the ship, was not immediately clear.

91.title: Congress wins Khairagarh Assembly seat in Chhattisgarh by-polls
91.article_body: Congress leader Yashoda Nilamber Verma on Saturday won the Khairagarh Assembly by-polls in Chhattisgarh by a margin of over 20,000 votes. Her nearest rival, BJP's Komal Janghel, got 67,703 votes. "The winning of Congress candidate is an outcome of Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel's policies in the state. Our leader took decision in favour of public," state minister Amarjeet Bhagat said.

92.title: Hardik has pretty relaxed approach towards the game: GT pacer Ferguson
92.article_body: Complimenting Hardik Pandya for leading GT in IPL 2022, teammate Lockie Ferguson said the skipper has a pretty relaxed approach towards the game. "He plays the game to entertain people as much as to win the game. I think that kind of attitude breathes energy and life into the group," he added. GT are currently on top of the standings.

93.title: IAF won't buy 48 Russian Mi-17V5 helicopters to boost 'Make in India'
93.article_body: To boost the 'Make in India' programme, the Indian Air Force has shelved its plan to buy 48 additional Mi-17V5 medium-lift helicopters from Russia. India signed a deal with Russia for the acquisition of 80 Mi-17V5 helicopters that were inducted into the force in phases. An additional 48 were planned to be inducted but it will not be done anymore.

94.title: Bumrah told me bowler must be able to do everything his team needs: Krishna
94.article_body: On being asked about how he masters the skill of bowling, RR pacer Prasidh Krishna said he has closely worked with coach Omkar Salvi for last four years and goes to him for any technical advice. He added that MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah once told him that a bowler should be able to do everything the team needs.

95.title: It's response to something else: Joe on keeping relationship with Taylor private
95.article_body: Speaking about keeping his relationship with singer-songwriter Taylor Swift private, English actor Joe Alwyn said that it's not because he wants to be guarded but because it's a response to something else. "We live in a culture that is so increasingly intrusive. The more you give, and frankly even if you don't give it, something will be taken," Joe added.

96.title: Meghan Markle gives her coat worth ₹3 lakh to mother holding a baby; pics viral
96.article_body: Pictures and video showing Meghan Markle giving her Max Mara coat said to be worth over ₹3 lakh (£3,080) are going viral on social media. Prince Harry and Meghan were being escorted to the venue of Invictus Games in The Hague, Netherlands, by competitors when Meghan gave the coat. "Queen of kindness," social media user said.

97.title: Dinesh Karthik smashes most runs in an over by an RCB batter in IPL 2022
97.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik smashed 28 runs, including four fours and two sixes, in an over on the bowling of DC pacer Mustafizur Rahman. With this, he recorded the most runs scored in an over by an RCB batter in IPL 2022. He's followed by Glenn Maxwell, who smashed 23 runs in an over bowled by DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav.

98.title: We are making every effort for 'Munna Bhai 3': Sanjay Dutt
98.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt in an interview has stated that they are making every effort for 'Munna Bhai 3', adding that filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani also wants to make the film. "We've done other movies...we've done 'PK' and may do more such films in future. But when talking about the fans, I'm sure that they're most interested in Munna Bhai," Sanjay added.

99.title: He's done an amazing job: Mercedes' Hamilton on teammate Russell
99.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has praised Mercedes teammate George Russell for the "amazing job" he has done so far this season. Russell finished third in the Australian Grand Prix last Sunday. "He's working and really grafting away, he's doing an amazing job," Hamilton said. Russell is currently second in the driver standings behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc.

100.title: All-black apartment in UK goes for sale for ₹3.7 crore, pics surface
100.article_body: An apartment with all-black interiors has gone on sale in UK's Manchester for £375,000 (around ₹3.73 crores). Pictures from the unusual two-bedroom lodging showed black marble kitchen counters and black-coloured walls, along with gold-coloured taps and other fittings. The 990-square-foot space is described in the listing, as having 'Gotham City' vibes.

101.title: Curbs in China may delay Apple product shipments: Analysts
101.article_body: Lockdowns and curbs in China amid rising Covid-19 cases have started disrupting global supply chains and logistics, due to which, analysts say that delays in shipments of certain Apple products are possible. Quanta Computer Inc, which produces the bulk of MacBooks globally has shut operations and Apple supplier Pegatron has announced the suspension of its plants in Shanghai and Kunshan.

102.title: Tek Travels DMCC acquires 51% stake in Switzerland-based BookaBed AG
102.article_body: Tek Travels DMCC, which is a wholly owned subsidiary of TBO Tek Limited, has announced that it has acquired 51% shareholding of Switzerland-based B2B accommodation provider BookaBed AG. "We are excited to welcome everyone at BookaBed to the TBO family. BookaBed allows TBO's entry into the Irish market and strengthens our UK presence," TBO Co-Founder Gaurav Bhatnagar said.

103.title: We're happy: Shatrughan Sinha's wife on his win in Asansol by-polls
103.article_body: After Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Prasad Sinha won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls on Saturday, his wife Poonam Sinha said that they're happy "as the people of Asansol have welcomed them with open hands". She said, "It feels like we are from Asansol only. It can only happen in India where people love each other." Shatrughan Sinha defeated BJP's Agnimitra Paul.

104.title: Violence breaks out during Hanuman Jayanti rally in Delhi, injuries reported
104.article_body: Clashes broke out between two communities in Northwest Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti Shobha Yatra organised in the area on Saturday. Two policemen and others were injured in the incident as stones were pelted following an argument. CM Arvind Kejriwal condemned the incident and appealed for peace, adding, "Strict action should be taken against those who are guilty."

105.title: Lucknow is smiling, why wouldn't they: Irfan on LSG's 18-run win vs MI
105.article_body: Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to praise LSG after their 18-run win against MI in IPL 2022 and wrote, "Lucknow is smiling and why wouldn't they?? Playing high quality cricket!" Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Sixth straight defeat for MI...need some rethinking by the paltan. Great win LSG...in serious contention for the title! It's LSG's fourth win from six matches.

106.title: Ukraine's richest man pledges to help rebuild besieged Mariupol
106.article_body: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov has pledged to help rebuild Ukraine's Mariupol after a siege by Russian forces caused widespread destruction in the city. "Mariupol is a global tragedy and a global example of heroism. For me, Mariupol has been and will always be a Ukrainian city," he said. Akhmetov's Metinvest owns two iron and steelworks plants in Mariupol.

107.title: Sri Lankan stock exchange to halt trading for 5 days amid crisis
107.article_body: The Colombo Stock Exchange will remain shut for five business days from April 18, according to the Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka. The move is aimed at providing investors an opportunity to have "more clarity and understanding" of the current economic conditions, it said. Sri Lanka is dealing with its worst economic crisis since its independence in 1948.

108.title: CBI denied further custody of Deshmukh over unsatisfactory grounds
108.article_body: A special CBI court on Saturday denied the central agency further custody of former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh calling the grounds stated by the CBI "not good and unsatisfactory". CBI had sought three more days of his custody in connection to a corruption case. The court sent Deshmukh and three other accused to judicial custody till April 29.

109.title: Prominent businessman allegedly rapes son's wife, threatens to kill her son in Guj
109.article_body: A prominent businessman has been accused of raping his daughter-in-law repeatedly and threatening to kill her 18-year-old son if she disclosed the offence to anybody in Gujarat's Jamnagar. Police said that the woman and her husband were staying separately because of regular fights. The woman stated that her father-in-law told her he would never let her feel her husband's absence.

110.title: MI let too many good players go, rebuilding team is difficult: Azharuddin
110.article_body: Speaking about MI's performance in IPL 2022, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said they let too many good players go and rebuilding the side will be quite difficult. "They had the likes of Pandya brothers, Quinton de Kock and Boult as well. Currently, they don't have many skillful players," he added. MI have lost six matches in a row.

111.title: Delhi sees 461 new COVID-19 cases & 2 deaths, positivity rate at 5.3%
111.article_body: Delhi on Saturday recorded 461 fresh COVID-19 cases and two related deaths in the last 24 hours. The national capital's daily COVID-19 positivity rate jumped to 5.33% from 3.95% the previous day, while it reported 269 COVID-19 recoveries in the last 24 hours. Delhi now has 1,262 active cases of coronavirus.

112.title: TikTok star attacked with acid while live-streaming in Aus; later shows her scars
112.article_body: Masked men threw acid on 32-year-old TikTok star Jenny Elhassan's face while she was live-streaming outside a restaurant in Australia's Sydney. "See the burn marks on my neck and the burn marks across my head. And my eyesight," she said in a video she released from hospital. "Top layer of my eye is coming off," she said in another video.

113.title: PM to inaugurate Ayush Summit in Gandhinagar in WHO chief's presence
113.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate a three-day global Ayush Summit at Mahatma Mandir in Gandhinagar in the presence of the World Health Organization chief Dr Tedros Ghebreyesus and Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth, a government release said on Saturday. The event will take place on April 20. PM Modi will visit Gujarat from April 18-20.

114.title: RCB will definitely make it to playoffs in IPL 2022: Shastri
114.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said RCB are definitely going to make it to the playoffs in IPL 2022. "They're getting hotter and hotter as the tournament is progressing. They're looking in a good space," he added. RCB were on a three-match winning streak until their last match against CSK, which they lost by 23 runs.

115.title: Even SRH bowlers didn't know where the ball was going: KKR captain Shreyas
115.article_body: Following their defeat against SRH, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said that SRH bowlers executed their plans really well in the match. "The ball was seaming at the start. Their bowlers also didn't know where the ball was going," Iyer added. He further said that KKR batters put on a "great effort" to register a total of 175/8.

116.title: He has played a big role: Brevis on his relationship with compatriot ABD
116.article_body: Talking about his "special relationship" with AB de Villiers, Dewald Brevis said the ex-South Africa cricketer has played a "big role" in his career so far. "He teaches me small things that help me a lot. It's about my mindset, the way to play the game," he added. The 18-year-old South Africa batter is currently representing MI in IPL 2022.

117.title: Captain of sunken Russian warship 'killed in explosion': Ukraine
117.article_body: Ukrainian officials said the captain of Russia's sunken warship Moskva was 'killed in an explosion' following a missile strike. Advisor to Ukraine's Ministry of Internal Affairs Anton Gerashchenko said First Rank Captain Anton Kuprin, 44, died in "an explosion and fire". Moskva, the flagship of Russia's Black Sea fleet, sank on Thursday. "We do not mourn," Gerashchenko added.

118.title: 20-yr-old admitted to ICU after suffering lung injury from masturbating in Switzerland
118.article_body: A 20-year-old man was admitted to ICU in Switzerland after he suffered a rare lung injury while masturbating, doctors' case report stated. The man, who had mild asthma, reported "sudden onset of sharp chest pain followed by shortness of breath while lying in bed masturbating". He was diagnosed with rare spontaneous pneumomediastinum, triggered by violent coughing and strenuous physical exercise.

119.title: Karisma Kapoor reveals Alia Bhatt's kaleera fell on her, shares pics
119.article_body: Actress Karisma Kapoor on Saturday took to Instagram to share pictures from Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's kaleera ceremony. The 47-year-old actress wrote in the caption, "The Kaleera fell on me guys! #couldibemoreexcited." As per Punjabi wedding customs, a bride's kaleera falling on a girl is considered to be a sign that she will be the next to get married.

120.title: Finland 'highly likely' to join NATO after Ukraine war: Minister
120.article_body: Minister for European Affairs and Ownership Steering Tytti Tuppurainen said Finland is "highly likely" to join NATO following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "At this point all I can say that it is highly likely, but the decision is not yet made," she said. Russia has threatened to deploy nuclear weapons to the Baltics if Finland or Sweden join NATO.

121.title: Gorakhnath Temple attack accused's judicial custody extended by 14 days
121.article_body: The Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate court in Gorakhpur has extended the judicial custody of Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, who had attacked police officers outside Gorakhnath Temple, by 14 more days. Reportedly, the court also transferred Abbasi's case to Anti-Terrorism Squad or National Investigation Agency Special Court in Lucknow. Abbasi allegedly tried to break into the temple on April 3.

122.title: We're shocked at PM's silence: 13 Opposition leaders condemn communal violence
122.article_body: Thirteen leaders of Opposition parties have issued a statement condemning recent incidents of communal violence that broke out in several states. "We're shocked at the silence of the PM who's failed to speak against the...actions of those who propagate bigotry," said the statement, signed by Congress, NCP chiefs Sonia Gandhi and Sharad Pawar. CMs of three states also signed it.

123.title: Chhattisgarh Cong MLA's son booked for assaulting policeman
123.article_body: Ritik Nayak, the son of Congress' Raigarh MLA Prakash Nayak, has been booked for allegedly assaulting a policeman and a truck driver inside a police station in Chhattisgarh on Saturday, an official said. The victims have filed two separate FIRs against Ritik, the official added. No arrest has been made in connection with the cases, the official further said.

124.title: MI record their worst-ever start to an IPL season, lose first 6 matches in a row
124.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) have recorded their worst-ever start to an IPL season after losing their first six matches in a row in IPL 2022. Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) defeated MI by 18 runs in their IPL 2022 encounter on Saturday to record their fourth win in the tournament. The match witnessed KL Rahul score his third hundred in IPL.

125.title: DC to bowl first against RCB, Mitchell Marsh makes his debut for DC
125.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB). DC have made one change to their playing XI, with Mitchell Marsh replacing Sarfaraz Khan to make his debut for DC. Meanwhile, all-rounder Harshal Patel has replaced Akash Deep in RCB's playing XI.

126.title: YouTube Shorts to be made available on desktops and tablets
126.article_body: YouTube's short-video content section, 'YouTube Shorts', so far only available to mobile users will now also be accessible on desktops and tablets, Google has said about expanding the Shorts experience. Within Shorts, YouTube is also introducing an optional 'Cut' feature to allow users to mix parts of other users' videos into their own. Shorts will remain unavailable on Smart TVs.

127.title: 2 court officials to be questioned over leaked visuals in actress assault case
127.article_body: Two officials attached to Kerala's Ernakulam Principal Sessions Court will be questioned by police over the leaking of the visuals of the sexual assault of a Malayalam actress in 2017. This comes after a forensic report revealed that the memory cards containing the visuals of the sexual assault were accessed and their hash value changed during the custody of court.

128.title: Onscreen kiss between same-sex actors will never be normalised: Mugdha Godse
128.article_body: Actress Mugdha Godse has stated that anything like an onscreen kiss between same-sex actors will never be normalised. She kissed actress Shruti Seth in web series 'Bloody Brothers'. "I knew it will be the talk of the town...Making it look good was my aim," Mugdha added. She further said many makers put bold scenes to amp up the masala quotient.

129.title: He's a pleasure to watch: Vaughan on KL Rahul's 60-ball 103* vs MI
129.article_body: After LSG captain KL Rahul hit 60-ball 103* against MI in IPL 2022, Michael Vaughan tweeted, "If not the nicest player to watch in the game he has to be bloody close...Rahul is a pleasure to watch." He added, "All young players should try and copy him." Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "Rahul, always a selfless team man, opener...crisis manager and captain-in-waiting."

130.title: May month to be dedicated to women in Himachal Pradesh: Anurag Thakur
130.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said the month of May will be dedicated to the women in Himachal Pradesh. The BJP leader said, "During this one month, attention would be given to the women-related issues and all sorts of tests would be conducted." On AAP's visits to the state amid upcoming elections, Thakur said, "[AAP] has no ground here."

131.title: YouTuber Karl returns to India over 500 days after being blacklisted by govt
131.article_body: YouTuber Karl Edward Rice, popularly known as Karl Rock, has returned to India 514 days after being blacklisted by the Indian government. Posting a video about the same, Rock explained that his visa was cancelled while he was exiting India to travel to Dubai and Pakistan in 2020. The New Zealand national is married to fashion content creator Manisha Malik.

132.title: Ishan Kishan smashes boundary cushions with bat in anger, video goes viral
132.article_body: MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan smashed the boundary cushions with his bat in anger while walking back to the pavilion after getting out in their IPL 2022 match against LSG. Kishan was bowled by LSG all-rounder Marcus Stoinis for 13(17) in the seventh over. Ishan has scored 14, 26, 3 and 13 runs in his last four innings.

133.title: Mortal remains of Indian student killed in Canada arrive in Ghaziabad
133.article_body: The mortal remains of 21-year-old Kartik Vasudev, who was shot dead in Canada, arrived at his residence in Ghaziabad on Saturday. A management student, he was travelling to work at a restaurant in the Downtown area when he was shot outside the subway station. The suspected killer, 39-year-old Richard Jonathan Edwin, was arrested by police earlier this week.

134.title: Retd Mumbai Police Inspector booked for blackmailing, raping woman
134.article_body: A retired Mumbai Police Inspector has been booked on charges of blackmailing and raping a woman who had approached him with a complaint in 2019. Gangadhar Patil had allegedly sent the woman romantic Whatsapp messages before threatening her and engaging in a physical relationship with her. Patil is currently absconding and a team has been formed to track him down.

135.title: I don't regret that at all: Rangnick over taking Man Utd manager job
135.article_body: Interim manager Ralf Rangnick said he has "no regrets whatsoever" over taking the job at Manchester United. "I would do it over and over again. I don't regret that at all," he said. Rangnick joined the club on an interim basis in November. Under Rangnick, 63, Manchester United have won nine out of his 22 matches in charge so far.

136.title: 2 arrested with charas worth ₹60 lakh near Mumbai's Dharavi
136.article_body: Mumbai Police's anti-narcotics cell recovered 2.25 kg of charas worth over ₹60 lakh after searching two persons near the Dharavi Koliwada bus stop. The accused, Sunil Nayak and Nevji Miya who hail from Rajasthan and Bihar respectively, were arrested and are being interrogated about the source of the drugs. Police believe they supplied charas to drug peddlers across the city.

137.title: Will avoid on-track battles with Hamilton: Mercedes' Russell
137.article_body: Mercedes' George Russell said he and teammate Lewis Hamilton will avoid any on-track battles this season until Mercedes are back amongst the mix to win Formula One races. Russell said Mercedes have not closed the gap "at all" on Ferrari and Red Bull. Russell finished third in the Australian Grand Prix last Sunday ahead of Lewis Hamilton in fourth.

138.title: World no. 3 Zverev beats Sinner to reach Monte Carlo Masters SFs
138.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev on Friday beat Jannik Sinner 5-7, 6-3, 7-6(5) to reach the semi-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "I've lost long matches like that, so I'm happy I won this one," Zverev said. The German will face world number five and defending champion Stefanos Tsitsipas in the semi-final.

139.title: Complaint against Punjab CM for allegedly visiting gurudwara after getting drunk
139.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Tajinder Bagga has filed a police complaint against Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann for allegedly entering Gurudwara Damdama Sahib while being drunk on Baisakhi. Taking to Twitter to announce the same, Bagga said, "I request Punjab Police DGP to take action on my complaint." He also shared a screenshot of the complaint.

140.title: Indian-American politician reacts as professor calls India a 'shithole'; says 'disgusted'
140.article_body: Indian-American Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi said he's "disgusted" after University of Pennsylvania's law professor Amy Wax called India a "shithole" while slamming Indian immigrants for criticising racism in US. "After President Trump left office, I thought the days of calling others 'shithole' countries were over...Comments like these...fuel hate crimes against minorities," he tweeted.

141.title: Sri Lanka seeks India's help to maintain cooking gas supply
141.article_body: Sri Lanka has initiated a process through the High Commission of India to obtain an Indian credit line to import gas, according to the resignation letter of the Chairman and CEO of state-run Litro Gas. Theshara Jayasinghe said that he was resigning as he didn't receive the fullest cooperation from the government. He also alleged corruption in the gas business.

142.title: Congress' Jadhav Jayshri Chandrakant wins Kolhapur North by-polls
142.article_body: Congress on Saturday managed to retain the Kolhapur North Assembly seat in Maharashtra as its candidate Jadhav Jayshri Chandrakant defeated BJP's Satyajeet Kadam by over 19,000 votes in the by-polls. The by-polls were necessitated after Congress MLA Chandrakant Jadhav died of COVID-19 in December 2021. Congress fielded his widow from the seat and she got 97,332 votes.

143.title: Tsitsipas beat Schwartzman, faces Zverev in Monte Carlo semis
143.article_body: Defending champion Stefanos Tsitsipas beat 12th seeded Diego Schwartzman 6-2, 6-7(3-7), 6-4 in quarter-final at Monte-Carlo Masters on Friday. Tsitsipas will now face second seeded Alexander Zverev, who defeated Jannik Sinner 5-7, 6-3, 7-6(7-5), in semi-final. In second semi-final, unseeded players Alejandro Davidovich Fokina and Grigor Dimitrov will play against each other for a spot in final.

144.title: Let TN send essentials to Sri Lanka from Thoothukudi: CM to Centre
144.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has requested the Centre to allow the state to ship essential commodities from the Thoothukudi port to Sri Lanka as humanitarian aid to the people, especially the Tamils. During his meeting with PM Modi in March, MK Stalin spoke about Tamil Nadu's willingness to provide essential commodities and life-saving medicines to the Lankan Tamils.

145.title: KL Rahul's 'fingers in ears' celebration after slamming hundred goes viral
145.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul's celebration after smashing a hundred against Mumbai Indians (MI) has gone viral. The 29-year-old covered his ears with his fingers to celebrate the hundred. Rahul, who has celebrated hundreds in similar fashion earlier as well, had once revealed that it signified "shutting out the noise".

146.title: Ex-Amnesty India chief can leave India, CBI needn't apologise: Court
146.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday said that former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel can fly abroad, upholding the April 7 order of another court that quashed the lookout circular issued against him by CBI. The court added CBI needn't give a written apology to Patel. CBI chief was asked to apologise after the agency's officers stopped Patel from leaving India.

147.title: Neetu Kapoor shares pics of Ranbir Kapoor, Riddhima from mehendi
147.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor shared a series of pictures of her son Ranbir Kapoor along with his sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni from his mehendi ceremony with actress Alia Bhatt. Neetu wrote in the Instagram caption, "Mehendi mast." Ranbir and Alia got married in an intimate ceremony on April 14. Alia has shared pictures from the wedding and mehendi on Instagram.

148.title: Gal Gadot congratulates Alia Bhatt on wedding with Ranbir Kapoor
148.article_body: Hollywood actress Gal Gadot has wished actress Alia Bhatt on her wedding with actor Ranbir Kapoor. Gal commented "Congratulations" along with a heart emoji on the series of pictures from the mehendi ceremony shared by Alia on Instagram on Saturday. Alia will be making her Hollywood debut alongside Gal in Tom Harper's upcoming spy film 'Heart of Stone'.

149.title: Spreading hatred since decades: BJP replies to Sonia's 'virus of hate' remark
149.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh has criticised Congress President Sonia Gandhi's 'virus of hate' remark which she said in her newspaper article on Saturday. "Congress kept the virus of hatred, to its zenith for decades, destroyed the country's culture for vote bank politics, that Congress is advising us today," Chugh said.

150.title: KL Rahul smashes hundred in his 100th IPL match
150.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul smashed a hundred in his 100th IPL match, against Mumbai Indians (MI) today. The 29-year-old opener reached the three-figure mark off 57 deliveries. It is his third hundred in IPL. He is the third Indian batter after Virat Kohli and Sanju Samson to smash at least three hundreds in IPL.

151.title: Man refuses to build table for PM in viral reply to 'PMO'; FIR claims PMO mail is fake
151.article_body: Delhi Police has registered an FIR based on a complaint against an imposter posing as PM's Office (PMO) official after a designer's email reply refusing to build a table for PM Narendra Modi went viral. Designer Kunal Merchant had shared an email from a person claiming to be PM's Private Secretary. Merchant declined the offer citing political and ideological differences.

152.title: After spike in Noida's COVID cases, UP puts districts near Delhi on alert
152.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government directed officials to put all districts bordering Delhi-NCR on alert mode against COVID-19 on Saturday, according to an official statement. The decision was taken in a meeting chaired by UP CM Yogi Adityanath. Notably, a significant rise in COVID-19 cases in neighbouring areas, especially Noida, has been reported over the past few days.

153.title: He's saying 'I am here too': Murali Kartik on Tripathi's 37-ball 71
153.article_body: Reacting to SRH batter Rahul Tripathi's 71 off 37 balls in the win against KKR, ex-India spinner Murali Kartik tweeted, "Rahul has been saying, '[I] am here too' every year since he played for Rising Pune Supergiant." "Every year Rahul comes to IPL [and] does his job quietly but surely," read a tweet from ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan.

154.title: Bollywood has forgotten heroism, South industry didn't: Sanjay Dutt
154.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt has stated that Bollywood has forgotten heroism, adding that a hero should have a mind-blowing entry. "Woh chalta hai to dhool udni chahiye, seeti bajni chahiye (When he walks, dust should be flying, there should be whistles)...Look at 'Jaan Ki Baazi', 'Khal Nayak'," the actor added. He further said that the South film industry never forgot heroism.

155.title: Everyone can say Suryakumar should bat higher up, I disagree: Hogg
155.article_body: Talking about MI batter Suryakumar Yadav, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "Everyone can say Suryakumar should bat higher up the order. I don't think so." "Suryakumar is experienced and you need that at the back end. He can do that job," added Hogg. "It'll also put him in a good position to represent India a lot more often," stated Hogg.

156.title: Umran Malik can easily take out Asian batters on Aus pitches: Rashid Latif
156.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Rashid Latif has said that SunRisers Hyderabad pacer Umran Malik can easily dismiss "the Asian batters" if he plays on Australia's "bouncy pitches" in this year's T20 World Cup. "He could be a very useful bowler there [Australia]. Because batters aren't used to facing such fast bowling nowadays. Most pacers have now [reduced speed]," Latif said.

157.title: Prez Biden & First Lady earned over $6,00,000 in 2021: White House
157.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden have earned $6,10,702 in 2021, according to copies of their tax return made public by the White House. The couple paid $1,50,439 or 24.6% of their earnings as federal income tax. Vice President Kamala Harris and her husband, Doug Emhoff, reported earning $16,55,563 and paying $5,23,371 in federal income tax.

158.title: Baby AB, Tilak can do wonders, showing what they're capable of: Suryakumar
158.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav has said that the franchise's batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, and batting all-rounder Tilak Varma can do "wonders" few years down the line. "They're literally showing us what they are capable of doing," added Suryakumar. Dewald scored a 25-ball 49 in MI's previous match against PBKS at a strike rate of 196.

159.title: Apocalypse of hatred, intolerance, untruth engulfing country: Sonia Gandhi
159.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre in an article she wrote in a newspaper. "An apocalypse of hatred, bigotry, intolerance and untruth is engulfing our country today. If we don't stop it now, it will...damage our society beyond repair," Gandhi wrote. "Let us contain this raging fire, this tsunami of hate that has been unleashed," she added.

160.title: 45-year-old RSS worker killed in Kerala's Palakkad
160.article_body: A 45-year-old RSS worker, identified as Srinivasan, was killed in Kerala's Palakkad on Saturday, police said. Srinivasan was allegedly attacked by a group of assailants at his shop, police added. The suspects arrived at the spot on motorbikes and allegedly hacked Srinivasan to death, police further said. This comes a day after an SDPI worker was killed in Palakkad.

161.title: More Chinese cities impose COVID-19 curbs as cases rise in Shanghai
161.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai on Saturday reported a record number of symptomatic COVID-19 cases as other cities in the country imposed new restrictions. China's Xian and Suzhou cities have urged residents to avoid unnecessary trips outside their residential compounds and work from home. Economists have said that the COVID-19 curbs will weigh on the country's economic growth rate this year.

162.title: 14 kids among 70 new COVID-19 patients in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar
162.article_body: Of the 70 new COVID-19 patients in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar since 6 am on Friday, 14 are children below 18 years of age, the district health department said on Saturday. The number of active cases in the district has now reached 218, officials said. At least eight people have recovered since Friday morning, officials added.

163.title: Every Indian paying price for hate fueled by BJP-RSS: Rahul Gandhi
163.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took to Twitter and accused the Bharatiya Janata Party and RSS of spreading hate in the country. He wrote, "Every Indian is paying the price for the hate-fueled by BJP-RSS." He also shared an article by Sonia Gandhi where she criticised the BJP government for the alleged rise in 'hatred' and 'crimes against minorities'.

164.title: Yash's KGF 2 collects ₹300 cr worldwide, Hindi version earns ₹100 cr
164.article_body: Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' has collected ₹300 crore worldwide in just two days of its release, as per film trade analyst Ramesh Bala. Meanwhile, the Hindi version of the film has earned ₹100 crore in India. According to Taran Adarsh, the Hindi version collected ₹53.95 crore on Thursday and ₹46.79 crore on Friday. 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' also stars Sanjay Dutt.

165.title: No matter how good an actor is, he can’t pull off a bad script: Jaideep
165.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat in a recent interview revealed that makers often approach him with below standard scripts and expect him to pull it off. Jaideep said he strongly believes that however good an actor is, he cannot pull off a bad script. "A very bad script cannot be made into 'The Godfather'. That is not possible," he added.

166.title: After calling off series in 2021, NZ and England to tour Pak later this year
166.article_body: England and New Zealand cricket teams will tour Pakistan in September and December this year, respectively. Both the nations had called off their respective tours to Pakistan last year, citing security concerns. England will play three Tests and seven T20Is, while New Zealand will play two Tests and three ODIs in the country, the Pakistan Cricket Board said.

167.title: Salute to voters: Mamata Banerjee after TMC's victory in WB by-polls
167.article_body: TMC chief and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee today thanked the voters after the party won the Ballygunge Assembly by-polls and the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls. Banerjee further "saluted voters for reposing faith in TMC and for giving a decisive mandate". TMC leader Babul Supriyo won the Ballygunge by-polls, while TMC's Shatrughan Prasad Sinha won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls.

168.title: Shah Rukh Khan begins shooting for Rajkumar Hirani's next: Report
168.article_body: After completing the shoot for 'Pathaan' and director Atlee's yet-to-be-titled film, Shah Rukh Khan has reportedly begun shooting for Rajkumar Hirani's next project. "SRK started shooting for Rajkumar Hirani's film on Wednesday," Indian Express quoted a source as saying. According to reports, the movie is currently being filmed in Punjab, following which it will be shot in Budapest and London.

169.title: Ranbir, Alia to host a post-wedding party at their residence: Reports
169.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will be hosting a post-wedding party for their friends and colleagues in Bollywood at their apartment in Vastu on Saturday, according to reports. Shah Rukh Khan, Varun Dhawan, Ayan Mukerji and Sanjay Leela Bhansali are among the people who have been invited to the party, reports stated. Ranbir and Alia tied the knot on Thursday.

170.title: Umran Malik's role is to run in and express himself: SRH head coach Moody
170.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad head coach Tom Moody has said that pacer Umran Malik's role in the IPL franchise is to "run in and express himself". "Umran has been embraced by the franchise...At the end of the day, when you are bowling 150 kmph in this format, you don't expect you are not going to go for runs," Moody said.

171.title: BTS' J-Hope shares pics with Lady Gaga, says 'My forever queen'
171.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS member J-Hope, who recently attended Lady Gaga's Las Vegas concert 'Lady Gaga Enigma + Jazz & Piano', took to Instagram to share a few pictures with the singer. "On the stage she was incredible, but off...stage, she was so professional," he wrote, adding, "Lady Gaga, my queen forever!!! I cheer you on as a fan!!!"

172.title: SRH completely dominated their chase of 176 against KKR: Pragyan Ojha
172.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said SRH completely dominated their chase of 176 in the win against KKR, adding that Rahul Tripathi, who was the highest run-getter in the match with 71(37), was "extraordinary". "You can see the difference between the...bowling attacks of both sides," added Ojha. SRH recorded their third consecutive win after beating KKR.

173.title: Man alleges doctors' role in illegal abortions, extorts ₹30 lakh in Pune
173.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 35-year-old man, Mangesh Manik Kanchan, for allegedly extorting ₹30 lakh from two doctors. Police said that Kanchan told doctors that he has a video clip of illegal abortions being performed. He also said that he would implicate them in a false case and demanded the money from them for not doing so.

174.title: Miley Cyrus spotted kissing 23-year-old Maxx Morando amid relationship rumours
174.article_body: Miley Cyrus was spotted kissing musician Maxx Morando on a sidewalk in West Hollywood amid reports that the duo are in a relationship. The rumours about Miley dating the 23-year-old started when they were spotted at Gucci's Love Parade runway show in November. Miley was earlier married to Liam Hemsworth from 2018 to 2020.

175.title: Good decision by Jersey team to release it with our film: Operation Romeo maker
175.article_body: Filmmaker Neeraj Pandey-backed 'Operation Romeo' will release in theatres on April 22, the same day as Shahid Kapoor-starrer 'Jersey'. Reacting to the same, Neeraj said, "I think it's a very good decision by the 'Jersey' team to release the film with 'Operation Romeo'." He added there's no clash between the two as both the films belong to very different genres.

176.title: Omicron-specific COVID-19 vaccine candidates cleared for clinical trial in China
176.article_body: Two candidates of Omicron-specific COVID-19 vaccine developed by units of China National Biotec Group (CNBG) have been approved for clinical trials in China.
