Steyn jumped out of his seat and celebrated the wicket with SRH spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan. Steyn later revealed that Muralitharan had predicted that Umran would bowl a yorker to Iyer on that delivery.

352.title: 4 men follow steel trader for 282 kms to Mumbai, loot ₹15 lakh cash
352.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested four men from Nashik for allegedly following a 26-year-old steel and metal trader for 282 kilometres on their bike, from Malegaon to Mumbai, and robbing him of ₹15 lakh cash at knifepoint in Parel. The four robbers were tracking the Malegaon-based trader Shahrukh Khan's movement and figured out that he carried cash to Mumbai every Sunday.

353.title: Fashion influencer who started Rihanna-A$AP Rocky cheating rumour apologises
353.article_body: Fashion influencer Louis Pisano has issued an apology after tweeting that Rihanna and A$AP Rocky had broken up after the rapper was "caught cheating" on the singer with shoe designer Amina Muaddi. "Last night I made a dumb decision to tweet some information I had received," Pisano wrote. "I apologise to them for this unnecessary drama," Pisano added.

354.title: VJ-actor Cyrus Sahukar marries longtime girlfriend Vaishali Malahara, pic surfaces
354.article_body: VJ, host and actor Cyrus Sahukar tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Vaishali Malahara on Friday. The wedding, that took place in Alibaug, was attended by Shruti Seth, Mini Mathur, Kabir Khan, Sahil Sangha and Devraj Sanyal, among others. Cyrus and Vaishali started dating each other over six years ago.

355.title: US-based Thoma Bravo contacts Twitter with acquisition offer: Report
355.article_body: US-based private equity firm Thoma Bravo has contacted Twitter and is putting together an acquisition offer that could rival Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid, as per a report. While it isn't yet clear as to how much Thoma Bravo will offer, a source said that the company could be a white knight for Twitter and CEO Parag Agrawal.

356.title: Mumbai's TIFR asks staff not to post anti-govt content on social media
356.article_body: Mumbai's Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR) has instructed its staff and their family members not to post any anti-government content on social media. The institute has also asked employees to refrain from posting pictures and videos of institute facilities on social media platforms like Facebook and WhatsApp. It added that such activities could lead to "serious security consequences".

357.title: Man kidnaps wife on suspicion of her character in Pune; 3 arrested
357.article_body: Pune police have arrested a man and his two associates for allegedly kidnapping his wife, as he suspected her character and wanted to murder her. The woman raised an alarm and threw her phone when the accused forcefully put her in a car, following which a passer-by informed police. Police learnt that the accused were in Phaltan and caught them.

358.title: Hyd Police share pic of congested road, urge public to follow traffic rules
358.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police took to Twitter to share a picture of a congested road with several vehicles standing haphazardly. "Follow traffic rules! Breaking traffic rules causes inconvenience to you and others too," police wrote on Twitter. A Twitter user, in the comments section, asked if 3 days imprisonment can be given to those who drive on wrong side.

359.title: Punjab announces 300 units of free power for households from July 1
359.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government in Punjab has announced 300 units of free power for households from July 1. This comes after Mann on Tuesday said his government will soon give "good news" to the people of Punjab. Providing free electricity to every household for up to 300 units was one of the poll promises made by AAP.

360.title: Woman murders 3-month-old daughter after fight with husband in Delhi
360.article_body: A 26-year-old woman allegedly strangled her three-month-old daughter to death after a fight with her husband at their residence in Delhi's Haiderpur area, police said. "She had a quarrel with her husband...over some domestic issue. When he left for work, she killed the baby in a fit of rage by pulling the thread worn around her neck," police added.

361.title: Man gets messages to pay off loan he didn't take, asks Hyd Police for help
361.article_body: A Twitter user shared screenshots of WhatsApp chats, claiming that he has been getting messages from "loan apps" to pay off the loan that he claimed he did not take from them. While tagging the Hyderabad Police in his tweet, he wrote, "Please help me sir. I'm getting these messages daily." Hyderabad Police asked him to approach nearest police station.

362.title: Woman dies after stray bull attacks her with its horns in Noida
362.article_body: A 55-year-old woman died after being attacked by a stray bull outside her house in Noida's Phase 1 on Friday morning. The woman was walking towards a shop to buy food for her children when the bull charged at her and attacked her with its horns, police said. The bull reportedly attacked her again when she fell down on road.

363.title: 8 accused of attacking Kejriwal's house garlanded at BJP Delhi office
363.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Thursday welcomed and garlanded eight BJYM workers, who were arrested on March 31 in connection with the attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house, at the party office. Gupta said they were jailed while protesting against "anti-Hindu" Kejriwal. "Each of our workers will always fight against anti-Hindu forces," he tweeted.

364.title: 11 persons were drunk during protest at Pawar's house: Mumbai Police
364.article_body: Mumbai Police said on Friday that 11 people, who participated in the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's house last week in Mumbai, were drunk. The police had taken the samples of 81 people. Police added that on April 7, a meeting was held at advocate Gunaratna Sadavarte's house and 20-25 people participated in it.

365.title: Rahul Tripathi slams 71(37) as SRH defeat KKR to register their 3rd win in a row
365.article_body: SRH defeated KKR by seven wickets to register their third consecutive victory in IPL 2022 and move to the seventh position on the points table. KKR, who have now lost two matches in a row, dropped to the fourth position. Rahul Tripathi's 71(37) and Aiden Markram's 68(36) helped SRH chase down 176-run target in 17.5 overs.

366.title: Sorry guys, really wanted to play: Deepak Chahar after being ruled out of IPL 2022
366.article_body: After being ruled out of IPL 2022 due to a back injury, CSK fast bowler Deepak Chahar took to Instagram to pen a note. He wrote, "Sorry guys...Really wanted to play but will come back better and stronger like I have always done. Thanks for always supporting me with your love and wishes. Need your blessings."

367.title: Robot that can be controlled remotely to treat stroke patients made by MIT
367.article_body: Engineers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a telerobotic system that can help doctors remotely treat patients experiencing a stroke or aneurysm using a modified joystick. The robotic arm has a magnet attached to its wrist and its orientation can be adjusted to guide a magnetic wire through the patient's arteries and vessels to remove blood clots.

368.title: China's Xi'an imposes partial lockdown to fight COVID outbreak
368.article_body: The local government in China's Xi'an city on Friday said that it will impose a partial lockdown from April 16 to April 19 after reporting dozens of COVID-19 infections this month. The announcement comes as a surge in coronavirus cases continues in other parts of the country. Residents should largely keep their movements within residential compounds, the government added.

369.title: From holding your tiny hands to seeing you as a bride: Alia's bodyguard on her wedding
369.article_body: Alia Bhatt's bodyguard Sunil Talekar posted a photo of himself with the actress and actor Ranbir Kapoor after their wedding ceremony. "From holding your tiny hands to seeing you as a bride I can say my heart is filled with happiness today," he wrote in the caption. "Cutest caption ever," an Instagram user commented.

370.title: If I was an Indian selector, I'd keep close eye on SRH's Natarajan: Vaughan
370.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said if he was an Indian selector then he'd be keeping a close eye on SRH pacer T Natarajan. "Looking at India, I think they'd be silly not to look at him," he added. Natarajan, who last played for India over a year ago, has taken 11 wickets from five matches in IPL 2022 so far.

371.title: Russia expels 18 European Union diplomats from Moscow
371.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Friday expelled 18 European Union diplomats from the country. Notably, the move comes after 19 Russian diplomats were ordered to leave the EU on April 5. "The EU is responsible for the consistent destruction of the architecture of bilateral dialogue and cooperation that had taken decades to form," the ministry said in a statement.

372.title: Video of US President Joe Biden's handshake in 'thin air' goes viral
372.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden's handshake in 'thin air' has gone viral. After finishing his speech at the North Carolina Agricultural & Technical State University, Biden turned and appeared to shake hands with 'thin air'. He looked apparently lost for a moment before walking off the stage. Some social media users said that his actions were being misinterpreted.

373.title: Situation of hosting Asia Cup in SL to be assessed on final day of IPL: Shah
373.article_body: Asian Cricket Council President and BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said situation of hosting Asia Cup 2022 in Sri Lanka will be assessed on final day of ongoing IPL. Sri Lanka is battling a severe economic crisis with food and fuel scarcity affecting the population. Asia Cup is scheduled to be hosted in Sri Lanka from August 27 to September 11.

374.title: WhatsApp emoji reactions soon to make their debut
374.article_body: Emoji reactions will be among the latest upcoming features on WhatsApp, as has been confirmed by Will Cathcart, Head of WhatsApp, in a tweet. He also announced the launch of several other features such as communities, larger file sharing, up to 32 participants on audio calls and greater admin control. The emoji reactions are also features of Instagram and Telegram.

375.title: Met Congress rebel MLAs, formed 'Team Sidhu': Navjot Singh Sidhu
375.article_body: After reports claimed that rebel Congress MLAs were planning to leave the party, former Punjab Congress President Navjot Singh Sidhu said that he held a meeting with rebel MLAs where 'Team Sidhu' was formed. 'Team Sidhu' will look into the problems raised by party MLAs, Sidhu said. "I will continue to fight for the interests of Punjab," he added.

376.title: 46-yr-old man beaten to death over monetary dispute in Jharkhand
376.article_body: Police investigating the death of a 46-year-old man, whose body was found at a dhaba near NH98 in Jharkhand's Palamu on Wednesday, believe he was beaten with a stick. The deceased, Pappu Shondik, had reportedly lent ₹10 lakh to dhaba owner who gave him two cheques in return. However, after the cheques bounced, Pappu pressured him to return the money.

377.title: Young women put sexualised images, but it's not their fault: Sonam
377.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor has stated that she sees a lot of her young colleagues who are catering to an audience by putting out highly sexualised imagery, adding that it's not their fault. "If I put a sexy photo of myself on Instagram, it's got like 10 times more likes than a picture of me in a pretty dress," Sonam said.

378.title: SBI to hire business consultant for prospects in EV space
378.article_body: India's largest public sector lender SBI has decided to hire a consultant to explore business opportunities for digital payments in the electric vehicle (EV) charging segment. The consultant will need to identify market potential, develop a strategic roadmap and provide recommendations on the next steps and areas for support through investments, said SBI in a request for proposal (RFP) document.

379.title: Twitter adopts 'poison pill' rights plan to block Musk's $43 billion takeover bid
379.article_body: Twitter is adopting a limited duration shareholder rights plan, often called a 'poison pill', after the world's richest man Elon Musk offered to buy the company for $43 billion. Under this plan, if any person or group acquires at least 15% of Twitter's stock without the board's approval, other shareholders will be allowed to purchase additional shares at a discount.

380.title: ₹1.90 cr unaccounted cash seized from 2 bus passengers in Andhra
380.article_body: Police in Andhra Pradesh on Friday recovered unaccounted cash worth ₹1.90 crore from two passengers travelling on a bus during a routine check. The accused have been arrested, police said. "The two could not produce any documentation for [the cash], therefore it was declared unaccountable cash and will be handed over to the Income Tax department," police added.

381.title: B'deshi teenager arrested for sneaking into India to buy chocolate
381.article_body: A Bangladeshi teenager was arrested for illegally crossing into India to buy chocolate from Sipahijala in Tripura, BSF officials said. Eman Hossain hails from a village next to a river that marks the international border between India and Bangladesh. He used to sneak through a hole in the barbed wire fencing to buy chocolate, but was caught on April 13.

382.title: 150 Palestinians injured in clashes with Israeli police in Jerusalem
382.article_body: More than 150 Palestinians were wounded in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Friday. Most of the injuries were incurred by rubber bullets, stun grenades and beatings with batons, the Palestine Red Crescent Society said. The Israeli police claimed that the clashes began after the Palestinians began hurling stones and firecrackers at security forces.

383.title: Death toll from floods in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal rises to 395
383.article_body: The death toll from flooding in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal Province rose to 395 on Friday. The floods have knocked out power lines, shut down water services and disrupted operations at port of Durban, one of Africa's busiest ports. Earlier, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa had visited the flood-hit parts of the province and promised to provide support to affected communities.

384.title: Bihar CM opens ₹550-crore soft drink bottling plant at Begusarai
384.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday opened a soft drink bottling plant, which is said to be worth ₹550 crore, at Asurari in Begusarai. State Industries Minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said the Pepsi bottling plant of Varun Beverages Limited would generate employment and give preference to locals. He further announced that 17 ethanol units would be opened soon in Bihar.

385.title: Man dies by suicide in Telangana hospital after son denied job
385.article_body: A 46-year-old man, who was undergoing treatment at a Telangana hospital, allegedly died after consuming pesticide on Thursday. He reportedly did so as his family was unable to pay hospital bills of ₹60,000 after his son was denied a job. The deceased's son had earlier been promised a job by authorities while acquiring his land for Kakatiya Thermal Power Project.

386.title: Sri Lanka starts rationing fuel amid severe economic crisis
386.article_body: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced it would ration fuel to the public from Friday, amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Buses, lorries and commercial vehicles have been exempted from the measure. Earlier this week, Sri Lanka had declared that it is defaulting on its $51 billion external debt.

387.title: PM Modi to unveil 108 ft Lord Hanuman statue in Gujarat tomorrow
387.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil a 108 feet statue of Lord Hanuman on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti in Gujarat's Morbi on Saturday. "This is the second of the four statues being set up in the four directions across India, as part of the #Hanumanji4dham project," informed the Prime Minister's Office. The first statue was set up in Shimla.

388.title: Twitter adopts shareholder rights plan after Musk offers to buy it for $43 billion
388.article_body: Twitter is adopting a limited duration shareholder rights plan, often called a 'poison pill', after the world's richest man Elon Musk offered to buy the company for $43 billion. Under this plan, if any person or group acquires at least 15% of Twitter's stock without the board's approval, other shareholders will be allowed to purchase additional shares at a discount.

389.title: Russian Defence Minister suffers heart attack, says businessman
389.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has suffered a massive heart attack that may not have occurred from natural causes, exiled Russian businessman Leonid Nevzlin has alleged. Nevzlin also said that Shoigu is "out of the game" and could be left disabled if he survives and is currently in intensive care. He added that 20 generals have been arrested amid war.

390.title: Shaheen shares pics from Alia-Ranbir wedding, says 'Our weird tribe got weirder'
390.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt on Friday took to Instagram to share pictures from Alia's wedding with Ranbir. She wrote, "My two favourite people in the world got married yesterday and our weird, happy little tribe just got a whole lot weirder and happier." The couple got married in an intimate ceremony on April 14 at Ranbir's Vastu residence.

391.title: Soni Razdan gifts son-in-law Ranbir watch worth ₹2.5 crore: Report
391.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan gifted her son-in-law actor Ranbir Kapoor a watch worth ₹2.5 crore at Alia and Ranbir's wedding on Thursday, reported Hindustan Times. It is reportedly a high-end watch which is from a brand that is not easily available. The wedding guests received Kashmiri shawls as a gift which were picked by Alia, the report added.

392.title: Burnley sack manager Sean Dyche amid PL relegation battle
392.article_body: Burnley on Friday announced they have parted company with manager Sean Dyche as the club struggles to avoid relegation from the Premier League this season. Dyche, 50, was the longest serving manager in the Premier League having been in charge of Burnley for nine-and-a-half seasons. Burnley are currently 18th on the Premier League table with 24 points.

393.title: West Ham Utd beat Lyon 3-0 to reach UEFA Europa League semi-finals
393.article_body: West Ham United on Thursday beat French side Olympique Lyonnais 3-0 to win their quarter-final tie 4-1 on aggregate to reach the semi-finals of the UEFA Europa League. Craig Dawson, Declan Rice and Jarrod Bowen scored the goals for the Premier League club. West Ham will face Eintracht Frankfurt in the semi-finals. The first-leg will take place on April 28.

394.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy is massive, getting very similar to Ashes: Lyon
394.article_body: Calling Border-Gavaskar Trophy "massive", Australia spinner Nathan Lyon said, "It's getting very similar to an Ashes series as pinnacle series for an Australian cricketer." He added, "This series with the World Test Championship on the line as well is going to be even more important and probably a bigger challenge." Since 2017, India have won three Border-Gavaskar trophies.

395.title: Bihar proposes to get 2,500-year-old wall UNESCO heritage site tag
395.article_body: According to Bihar's Art, Culture and Youth department, the state government has sent a proposal to the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to get a 2,500-year-old wall at Rajgir, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The 40 kms wall of stone was reportedly built before third century BC around the city of Rajgir to protect it from invaders.

396.title: Egypt has approved India as wheat supplier: Piyush Goyal
396.article_body: World's top wheat importer Egypt has approved India as a wheat supplier, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced on Friday. The development comes amid a sharp decline in availability of wheat in global markets due to the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, who are both major wheat exporters. Egypt is looking to import 1 million tonne of wheat from India.

397.title: Nothing will be achieved by painting JNU saffron: RJD's Manoj Jha
397.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal MP Manoj Kumar Jha condemned the 'Bhagwa JNU' posters and putting up of saffron flags outside Jawaharlal Nehru University campus. He said, "What will happen if the saffron flag is planted in JNU? This is a university. Understand the university's global philosophy. Nothing will be achieved by colouring university saffron, green, red and yellow."

398.title: Sarpanch shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Baramulla
398.article_body: An independent sarpanch, identified as Manzoor Ahmad Bangroo, was shot dead by terrorists at the Goshbugh area of Baramulla district in Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Friday. "He was shifted to hospital where doctors declared him brought dead," police added. His murder was condemned by L-G Manoj Sinha who said, "Perpetrators of this despicable act shall be punished."

399.title: Russia says it hit Ukrainian arms factory after sinking of Russian ship
399.article_body: Russia on Friday said its forces had struck a factory in Kyiv that made and repaired Ukrainian missiles. The attack comes after Ukraine claimed its missile strike had sunk the flagship of Russia's Black Sea fleet, Moskva, this week. However, Russia did not confirm that Ukrainian missile strikes had hit the ship.

400.title: KKR's Nitish Rana smashes SRH's fridge with a 69-metre six, video goes viral
400.article_body: KKR batter Nitish Rana smashed a six on the bowling of SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, in the 13th over, which went on to smash the fridge in the SRH dugout. The distance recorded for the maximum was 69 metres. Rana scored 54 runs off 36 deliveries in the innings. It was his 14th fifty in IPL.

401.title: Amber Heard once spit in my face when I asked for higher salary, claims former assistant
401.article_body: A former personal assistant to Amber Heard said the actress once spit in her face when she asked for a higher salary. Kate James said she was paid "very poorly" and that she was hired at an initial salary of $25 an hour. She added she never saw Heard suffer any physical abuse at the hands of then-husband Johnny Depp.

402.title: K'taka minister, booked for contractor's alleged suicide, resigns
402.article_body: Days after he was booked for a contractor's alleged suicide, BJP leader and Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa handed over his resignation to CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Friday. He said he was resigning "to prevent embarrassment to the BJP". The deceased contractor, Santhosh Patil, claimed Eshwarappa and his aides demanded a 40% commission to clear his nearly ₹4 crore bill.
